name: apt packages (for Debian/Ubuntu)
description: Advanced package tool, or APT, is a free-software user interface that works with core libraries to handle the installation and removal of software on Debian and Debian-based Linux distributions.

ppas.description: Comma separated list of required ppas (not recommended)

clean_ppas.description: If ppas used, remove them after usage in order to increase safety

preserve_apt_list.description: Preserving the existing apt list (the result of apt-get update) will decrease container layer size (but will require a re-update of the packages database on next install)

force_ppas_on_non_ubuntu.description: Installing ppas on a non-ubuntu distro (eg. debian) is discouraged
